main

Class Engine

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • main.Engine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    @Service
public class Engine
extends java.lang.Thread
    The engine is the main worker of the software. It will be in charge of following the software's logical process. It also manages data and handlers/workers, providing necessary inputs and resolving outputs.
    Author:
    skner

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Receives input from WEB GUI through JSON to run JMETAL'S ALGORITHMS. Sends results through email. Receives JSON from SPRING APP (needs JSON's final structure) This object will hold the information to be passed to the JMETAL algorithms Splits every algorithm run with jMetalHandler, using data.ProblemInputs's configuration list Executes every algorithm (jMetalHandler, after given the right inputs) During execution, jMetalHandler calls EmailSender to send emails on progress (Progress, ETA and other stats...) After generating, saves results (how? TBD) and sends to email.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread
